Children should not have to trade their health for an education. Thanks to @SenKamalaHarris, @RepBrownley, @RepJimCosta, @RepChuyGarcia, @RepKirkpatrick, @RepMikeLevin, #RepHimes, & @RepJohnLarson for joining me in standing for Americaâ€™s kids! #CleanSchoolBusAct

As a teacher in #Waterbury, I saw this first hand. When I looked into why many of my students were chronically absent, what I found was disturbing. The number one reason students were absent was asthma-related hospital visits. #CleanSchoolBusAct

Every day, more than 25 million children (& thousands of bus drivers) breathe polluted air during their commute to school, leading to asthma and other respiratory conditions. These health concerns are one of the biggest reasons why kids miss class. #CleanSchoolBusAct

Yesterday I introduced the #CleanSchoolBusAct, a new bill to help kids stay healthy, stay in class and cut greenhouse emissions. The bill would provide grants for schools to replace old diesel buses with new electric ones.
Itâ€™s time for the Senate to take up this deal and avoid another unconscionable government shutdown. #BudgetDeal

For too long we have prioritized military spending over important domestic priorities like #education and #healthcare. This budget refocuses our priorities to take care of issues at home, while making sure we have the resources to keep America safe.  #BudgetDeal
This week, both parties announced a bipartisan agreement to avoid another needless government shutdown. While it isn't a perfect deal it is a compromise to keep the government open. #BudgetDeal
At the beginning of the year, we saw the longest government shutdown in US history. #CT05 families were hurting. I said then and I said now that it was no way to govern. #BudgetDeal

Fifth: With enough support, the bill can be taken up by its committee of jurisdiction! In committee, they can hold a hearing to discuss a bill, or they can hold a mark-up where Members offer amendments and ultimately vote on whether to pass it out of the committee!

Fourth: We work with the Congresswoman to gain support! We ask advocacy groups, constituents, and other Members of Congress to support her bill. When a Member of Congress signs on, that is called a â€œcosponsorship.â€ We also drop off forms indicating cosponsors at the Cloakroom!

Third: The Congresswoman introduces the bill! We drop the bill off at the Cloakroom for the House Clerk! The Cloakroom was named after @GabbyGiffords and Leo J. Ryan in 2017. pic.twitter.com/fWqmIMh2f4

Second: We take those ideas, and we work with the Congresswoman to figure out how to craft a law to address the problem. Once we figure that out, we draft bill text! Hereâ€™s Maddie with text of our bossâ€™s bill, The Closing the College Hunger Gap Act! pic.twitter.com/SuPPDgeZ9m

Our kids are trying to get an education- we can not let them go hungry doing it.
Itâ€™s simple: hungry students donâ€™t learn. The Closing the College Hunger Gap Act would mandate that low-income students are notified of their SNAP eligibility when they apply for student aid.

I met with students, food pantry directors and college officials this spring, who told me something I was already familiar with from my experience in the classroom: food insecurity isnâ€™t just a hunger problem- it is a threat to college completion.

The current stats are shocking: 
 
>2 million at-risk students potentially eligible for SNAP did not receive benefits.
>30% of UConn students report skipping meals.
>30% of undergrad ECSU students report being food insecure.

Food insecurity and hunger is a problem on CT college campuses, and we have not done enough to address it. That stops now. Today, I will introduce the Closing the College Hunger Gap Act with @ChrisMurphyCT to ensure college students are protected from food insecurity. pic.twitter.com/wvDvIkhFlb
